abstract: Consolidated Edison proposal would install solar panels on its own facilities to provide energy for low-income New Yorkers; customers without financial resources or roof access who participate in program could save on their monthly electricity bills; project is response to call by government and public for Con Edison to increase its use of renewable energy.
lead_paragraph: The utility plans to ask state regulators this week for permission to install solar panels on some of its buildings in the city and to share the benefits with needy customers.
snippet: The utility plans to ask state regulators this week for permission to install solar panels on some of its buildings in the city and to share the benefits with needy customers....

headline.main: Con Ed Says Plan to Install Rooftop Solar Panels Will Aid Poor New Yorkers
headline.print_headline: Con Ed Says Plan to Install Rooftop Solar Panels Will Aid Poor Residents
